body:
> need to upgrade to antlr4

I have upgraded to antlr4.

> 修改一下加载tsfile的功能吧：
> 
> 用户有一个 tsfile，放在任意位置，使用 load工具 加载文件，
> 传入三个参数
> 
> tsfile 文件路径
> 2，是否根据tsfile的schema创建元数据（可选，默认创建）
> 3，存储组名字（可选，默认以路径前二层创建存储组， root.sg1 这种）
> load工具做的功能：
> 判断这个文件是否为 sequence文件，然后移动到对应文件夹，生成 resource

I don't think so. In a complete tsfile, the data type of timeseries and the storage group are fixed. It cannot change by users. I can add the feature of creating schemas automatically while the schemas don't exist.

> 修改一下加载tsfile的功能吧：
> 
> 用户有一个 tsfile，放在任意位置，使用 load工具 加载文件，
> 传入三个参数
> 
> tsfile 文件路径
> 2，是否根据tsfile的schema创建元数据（可选，默认创建）
> 3，存储组名字（可选，默认以路径前二层创建存储组， root.sg1 这种）
> load工具做的功能：
> 判断这个文件是否为 sequence文件，然后移动到对应文件夹，生成 resource

I have added the feature you requested, please check.

> the code is fine...I just wonder is it necessary

This feature is designed for helping our user to analyze the time consuming about their code. User can change almost nothing to analyze the performance about preprocessing.
Hello, could you help me check whether the server can return the normal prompt when I type the abnormal character abc? @Genius-pig

> Hello, could you help me check whether the server can return the normal prompt when I type the abnormal character abc? @Genius-pig

I can't understand. Can you give me an example?

> > Hello, could you help me check whether the server can return the normal prompt when I type the abnormal character abc? @Genius-pig
> 
> I can't understand. Can you give me an example?
```
IoTDB> abc
abc
Msg: Fail to execute abc after reconnecting. please check server status
It costs 3.271s
```

> > > Hello, could you help me check whether the server can return the normal prompt when I type the abnormal character abc? @Genius-pig
> > 
> > 
> > I can't understand. Can you give me an example?
> 
> ```
> IoTDB> abc
> abc
> Msg: Fail to execute abc after reconnecting. please check server status
> It costs 3.271s
> ```

```
IoTDB> abc
abc
Msg: line 1:0 mismatched input 'abc' expecting {CREATE, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, SELECT, SHOW, GRANT, SET, DESCRIBE, UNLINK, ADD, LINK, DROP, MERGE, LIST, ALTER, REVOKE, LOAD, UNSET, REMOVE, MOVE}
It costs 0.302s
```

@liutaohua 
please be cautious, if you input too many wrong SQL, the parse speed will be slower.

In short, the performance of `aggregate query without value filters` is optimized by enabling sequence data skipping at the chunk level whenever possible. To sum up the updated facilities:
- Aggregate Readers
  - `IAggregateReader`: add three interface methods
    - `hasNextChunk`
    - `nextChunkMeta`
    - `hasNextPageInCurrentChunk`
  - Readers which implement `IAggregateReader` are thus updated:
    - `MemChunkReader`
    - `FileSeriesReaderAdapter`
    - `IterateReader`
  - `FileSeriesReader` in the TsFile module is updated.
- Aggregate Functions
  - `AggregateFunction`: add an abstract method `calculateValueFromChunkMetaData`
  - Functions which extend `AggregateFunction` are thus updated:
    - `AvgAggrFunc`
    - `CountAggrFunc`
    - `MaxValueAggrFunc`
    - `MinValueAggrFunc`
    - `FirstValueAggrFunc`
    - `LastValueAggrFunc`
    - `MaxTimeAggrFunc`
    - `MinTimeAggrFunc`
- Aggregate Engine Executor
  - `AggregateEngineExecutor.aggregateWithoutValueFilter` method is modified
  - `AggregateEngineExecutor.handleLastMaxTimeWithOutTimeGenerator` method is modified

It looks good to me. Thank @liutaohua for your hard work.
The queryId2Plan is not necessary

Hi @jixuan1989 I appreciate if you can help to review the PR :)
Best,
Jincheng
For this PR, it should be cherry-picked to 0.8.* and 0.9.0 branches, too.
Thanks for the review and merge this @jixuan1989
Thanks for fixing that :)

> Should use some flag to distinguish using parser1 or parser2 logic, rather than use Exception to switch between the two logics.

I implement the two-stage method to improve speed. I get this idea from the antlr4 site. I think using a flag also needs to catch the exception. https://github.com/antlr/antlr4/blob/master/doc/faq/general.md. When you input the wrong SQL statement, the speed will be almost double slower. But who would enter so many wrong SQLs?
This pr make the code many times clearer than before :tada:

> 1. Remove uses of ThreadLocals in TSServiceImpl
> 2. TS_SessionHandles are replaced with sessionIds
> 3. TSOperationHandles are replaced with queryIds
> 4. Make queryId in TSServiceImpl generated by QueryResourceManager
> 
> To remove the constraint of serving each client with a separate thread, ThreadLocals in TSServiceImpl are removed. Instead, each session (connection) will be given a sessionId as the unique identifier. In every request that needs authentication, the sessionId must be passed along with to indicate who the client is.
> 
> This also fundamentally supports query management in the distributed version.

I have two questions to confirm:
1. Note that TSServiceImpl.currSessionId is still ThreadLocal<>(). So to be accurate, the use of ThreadLocal is not totally removed in TSServiceImpl.
2. `generateQueryId` is used in `TSServiceImpl.executeUpdateStatement`.  In `generateQueryId` method, `QueryFileManager.addQueryId` will new HashSet<>(). Is that a waste for update statements?

> > 1. Remove uses of ThreadLocals in TSServiceImpl
> > 2. TS_SessionHandles are replaced with sessionIds
> > 3. TSOperationHandles are replaced with queryIds
> > 4. Make queryId in TSServiceImpl generated by QueryResourceManager
> > 
> > To remove the constraint of serving each client with a separate thread, ThreadLocals in TSServiceImpl are removed. Instead, each session (connection) will be given a sessionId as the unique identifier. In every request that needs authentication, the sessionId must be passed along with to indicate who the client is.
> > This also fundamentally supports query management in the distributed version.
> 
> I have two questions to confirm:
> 
> 1. Note that TSServiceImpl.currSessionId is still ThreadLocal<>(). So to be accurate, the use of ThreadLocal is not totally removed in TSServiceImpl.
> 2. `generateQueryId` is used in `TSServiceImpl.executeUpdateStatement`.  In `generateQueryId` method, `QueryFileManager.addQueryId` will new HashSet<>(). Is that a waste for update statements?

1. Yes. I realized later that this ThreadLocal is still needed to retrieve the resources when the client is down so I added it, but I forget to update my description.
2. Good point. I think the data queries and non-data queries should be treated differently.
hi, any performance result?

> hi, any performance result?

Write is 4x slower than before

Could the deduplicated codes be removed in IoTDBQueryResultSet? Just use the deduplicated paths passed by server

Multi-thread:  The total cost of query is: 49368ms, the following figure is the profiling of the server side.  As we can see, most time is caused by fillRPCDataSet, the fetchResult is asynchronous. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7240743/71504442-6b70cb80-28b4-11ea-843b-960d9833c03b.png)

RaftMember.java 
Now we have to send request to all nodes and wait for quorum nodes responses. then we can commit the log.

How about:
1. guarantee there is only one connection between two nodes.
2. The leader can send the second req to a node after the first req is sent to the node.
3. However, the leader can commit log index i until i-1 is committed.

Hi，I have used iotdb-benchmark to test your code.I found an issue.
iotdb-benchmark config like below: 

- GROUP_NUMBER=20
- DEVICE_NUMBER=2000
- SENSOR_NUMBER=100
- CACHE_NUM=1000
- LOOP=500
- POINT_STEP=5000
- START_TIME=2018-09-20T00:00:00+08:00

So the time range of all timeseries will be  2018-09-20T00:00:00+08:00 ~ 2018-10-18T00:00:00+08:00.
 But we got almost 8917 folders under "data/data/sequence/root.perform.group_0" , named as “17768065” ~ “17787066”[refer to below picture].

The folders are not named as a day,but as 2 hours. 
please refer to this information.and check it again.
Thanks!

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40650975/71712200-26faa800-2e3f-11ea-8405-c83f67e36b5e.png)

as this reason,we got a very slowly response from commands " du -h -d1" and " rm -rf data"

PartitionGroup  extends ArrayList is a little heavy..
an array is enough.

> Hi，I have used iotdb-benchmark to test your code.I found an issue.
> iotdb-benchmark config like below:
> 
> * GROUP_NUMBER=20
> * DEVICE_NUMBER=2000
> * SENSOR_NUMBER=100
> * CACHE_NUM=1000
> * LOOP=500
> * POINT_STEP=5000
> * START_TIME=2018-09-20T00:00:00+08:00
> 
> So the time range of all timeseries will be 2018-09-20T00:00:00+08:00 ~ 2018-10-18T00:00:00+08:00.
> But we got almost 8917 folders under "data/data/sequence/root.perform.group_0" , named as “17768065” ~ “17787066”[refer to below picture].
> 
> The folders are not named as a day,but as 2 hours.
> please refer to this information.and check it again.
> Thanks!
> 
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40650975/71712200-26faa800-2e3f-11ea-8405-c83f67e36b5e.png)
> 
> as this reason,we got a very slowly response from commands " du -h -d1" and " rm -rf data"

Thanks for your testing. I found that our interval not consider the precision of time. That's means we use 86400ms rather than 86400s to divide data into different partition. That's my fault, I will fix it!

这个是内存不足导致的，为了控制内存，IoTDB 现在采用了比较悲观的内存估计策略，大概1万时间序列需要1G内存。如果内存不足会拒绝新的时间序列的创建。如果不想用这个自动检查，可以把 iotdb-engine.properties 里的 enable_parameter_adapter=true 改成 false。

如果只有顺序数据，那一个存储组需要 2倍的 memtable_size_threshold 的内存大小。如果有乱序，需要4倍的。可以大概估计一下内存大小，此外还有其他的一些元数据在占用内存，可以再多给几个G。

@qiaojialin 您好，我的实际情况是这样的，50万个设备，每5秒一条数据，不完全是时间序列（有可能有补报的数据上来），存储组按天设计root.20200108， 序列为root.20200108.设备ID， 每天约400GB的数据，分散在50万个序列上，也就是为了后期使用方便，我的序列默认就是一个设备一个序列。

对于我的需求场景为典型的key- list数据结构，因为初次接触IotDB，不知道这样的结构设计是不是最优，达到的效果为8GB内存+机械硬盘 单节点满足需求。
Both 0.9.0 and master have this bug.

1. 按天设计存储组不好。只有8G内存的话，可以考虑尝试10~50个存储组。 
2. 50万设备，如果这些设备都是5s来一条数据的话，并且有乱序数据，基本上每个设备不到4KB就会形成一个磁盘上的数据块。感觉内存稍微小了些。如果有性能结果，可以分享下。

Well, sometimes test failures still happen.
Let's fix it in next PR.
I would like to have a look.

> Thanks for the PR @JulianFeinauer
> The PR looks good to me for fix this issue, I only left one comment for simple the code change and one suggestion as follows:
> 
> I checked the entire project and found that `String.format` is used in many places(not only in test code). We are fortunate to find this `Local` problem in ITCase, but we cannot rule out that there are unpredictable problems hidden in other places, so I think would be better make a util similar with `String.format` in IoTDB , and set the configuration we need in the util, such as `Local` information, so that even if other problems are found in the future, we can fix it as a whole by modifying one place.
> 
> What do you think? @JulianFeinauer @jixuan1989

I  think many String.format() is used for log. Because all messages are in English, I wonder why a Locale is needed...
Excellent idea... The issue is that with e. G German locals decimal points are printed as comma...

@jixuan1989 if String.format is used for log only we have no issue but in the places above it is used to concatenate (or expand) Query Strings. And here, for some Locales (like e.g. German) the decimal points are expanded to decimal commas which leads to syntactically wrong statements, of course. So this, for sure, has to be Locale Invariant!
please try to merge master to check whether the failed test can pass.

金风科技在重点研发项目中使用了iotdb，实时消费kafka中的风机SCADA数据，使用方便接口方便,极值查询，函数计算基本上都是毫秒级返回。
北京创智信科，使用IoTDB存储中国铁塔设备监控数据，在试用阶段，IoTDB数据库的插入、存储、查询性能优越，目前正在进行压力和稳定性测试
北京清智物联在分析调相机(发电机)的在线监测数据，测试使用IoTDB，目前在等待分布式版本，用于诊断中心。
